page.title: 02SANDWICK GENERAL VIEW (cont)
page.content: There are two general stores/bakers and the others specialise in bicycles knitwear and Norwegian imported goods. The knitwear factory employs mainly home knitters but finishing, packing and weaving tweed are done on the premises. The tourist industry is important particularly as Sandwick is the link to the island of Mousa, site of the best preserved Pictish broch in Britain. The local churches are well atten- ded particularly the one at the head of Sandwick bay. Fishing is no longer of great importance to the local economy although some people travel from the area to work as fishermen or in fish processing.
